Use SLURM-managed mirai daemons

use_mirai_slurm.Rd

Helper function to launch mirai daemons through SLURM, ensuring compliance with HPC policies while maintaining low-latency execution.

Usage

use_mirai_slurm(
  n,
  partition = NULL,
  time = NULL,
  mem = NULL,
  cpus = NULL,
  tls = TRUE,
  port = 5555,
  ...
)

Arguments

n

Number of daemon jobs to submit

partition

SLURM partition name

time

Wall time limit (e.g., "2:00:00")

mem

Memory limit (e.g., "32G")

cpus

CPUs per task

tls

Use TLS encryption

port

Port for TLS connections

...

Additional SLURM options as name=value pairs

Value

A parade_dist object configured for SLURM-managed mirai

Examples

# \donttest{
# Launch 16 daemons on compute partition
use_mirai_slurm(
  n = 16,
  partition = "compute",
  time = "2:00:00",
  mem = "32G",
  cpus = 4
)
#> $backend
#> [1] "mirai"
#> 
#> $by
#> character(0)
#> 
#> $n
#> NULL
#> 
#> $url
#> mirai::host_url(tls = TRUE, port = 5555)
#> 
#> $remote
#> mirai::cluster_config(command = "sbatch", options = "#SBATCH --partition=compute\n#SBATCH --time=2:00:00\n#SBATCH --mem=32G\n#SBATCH --cpus-per-task=4\n#SBATCH --job-name=parade-mirai")
#> 
#> $dispatcher
#> [1] TRUE
#> 
#> $tls
#> [1] TRUE
#> 
#> $port
#> [1] 5555
#> 
#> $stop_on_exit
#> [1] TRUE
#> 
#> $within
#> [1] "mirai"
#> 
#> $workers_within
#> NULL
#> 
#> $chunks_per_job
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "parade_dist"
# }
